state.unstructured:
You are a medic on a security patrol. You encounter a serious accident potentially from an IED explosion. You were told that a civilian found what looked like it might be an IED, reported it to authorities, and then against our advice, went back and apparently triggered accidental detonation while taking a closer look. There are two civilian patients, one closer to what looks like the IED materials and one further away on a path.
Which patient do you treat first?

characters.name: Adiwijaya
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Found IED, reported it, and accidentally triggered it while taking a closer look.  Located closer to the IED materials.

characters.name: Bun
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Just happened to be nearby, located further from the IED materials.

characters.name: Adiwijaya
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Found IED, reported it, and accidentally triggered it while taking a closer look.  Located closer to the IED materials.

characters.name: Bun
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Fracture.

parameters.justification: Treating the civilian who accidentally triggered the explosion may be seen as a more morally justifiable action, as it prevents the potential harm to others.

response.unstructured:
You are a medic on a security patrol. You encounter a serious accident potentially from an IED explosion. You were told that a civilian found what looked like it might be an IED, reported it to authorities, and then against our advice, went back and apparently triggered accidental detonation while taking a closer look. There are two civilian patients, one closer to what looks like the IED materials and one further away on a path.
You began to treat the civilian further from the IED explosion. A bystander says, "Don't you think the other man has a much more urgent injury compared to the man you are treating? Shouldn't you take care of the other man first?" Who do you treat?

characters.name: Adiwijaya
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Found IED, reported it, and accidentally triggered it while taking a closer look.  Directly manipulated the IED even though he was told not to.  Located closer to the IED materials.
characters.unstructured_postassess: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Found IED, reported it, and accidentally triggered it while taking a closer look.  Directly manipulated the IED even though he was told not to.  Located closer to the IED materials.  Burns, puncture wound, heavy bleeding.

characters.name: Bun
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Located further from the IED materials.

response.unstructured:
You are a medic on a security patrol. You encounter a serious accident potentially from an IED explosion. You were told that a civilian found what looked like it might be an IED, reported it to authorities, and then against our advice, went back and apparently triggered accidental detonation while taking a closer look. There are two civilian patients, one closer to what looks like the IED materials and one further away on a path. A bystander says, "Don't you think the other man has a much more urgent injury compared to the man you are treating? Shouldn't you take care of the other man first?"
You receive a trusted update, "The explosion was not an accident.  The man closest to it made the report to try and lure US soliders to the site.  The bomb wasn't supposed to go off until later." You are told there is one helicopter transport spot. Who do you evacuate?

decision_environment.unstructured: You are informed there is one helicopter transport slot.

characters.name: Adiwijaya
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; insurgent.  Reported the presence of the IED to try and lure US soldiers to the site ot damage them.  Directly manipulated the IED even though he was told not to.  Located closer to the IED materials.
characters.unstructured_postassess: Male, mid-30s; insurgent.  Reported the presence of the IED to try and lure US soldiers to the site ot damage them.  Directly manipulated the IED even though he was told not to.  Located closer to the IED materials.  Burns, puncture wound, heavy bleeding.

characters.name: Bun
characters.unstructured: Male, mid-30s; local civilian.  Located further from the IED materials.
